intro: Gouania australiana, commonly known as the Australian goania, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Gouania australiana plays an important role in supporting local biodiversity by providing nectar for pollinators.
